conclusion: Use Snell's law and properties of refraction to solve the problem.
Ratio of radius of hollow part to radius of ball is 1:2; incident angle is 45 degrees.
If radius of ball is R, then radius of hollow part is R/2.
Light refracts at point A and is tangent to inner wall, angle of incidence at inner wall is 90 degrees.
Use Snell's law at first interface: n sin 45 = n1 sin r.
Light travels from outer surface to inner surface and back to outer surface.
Angle of incidence at first interface must be such that light is tangent to inner wall.
Use geometry to relate angle of incidence and angle of refraction.
Determine refractive index from angle of refraction and angle of incidence.
Speed of light in material is v = c/n.
